name: Mordekaiser
title: the Iron Revenant
lore: The baleful revenant Mordekaiser is among the most terrifying and hateful spirits haunting the Shadow Isles. He has existed for countless centuries, shielded from true death by necromantic sorcery and the force of his own dark will. Those who dare face Mordekaiser in battle risk a horrific curse: He enslaves his victims' souls to become instruments of destruction.
blurb: The baleful revenant Mordekaiser is among the most terrifying and hateful spirits haunting the Shadow Isles. He has existed for countless centuries, shielded from true death by necromantic sorcery and the force of his own dark will. Those who dare face...
allytips: You can control a pet by holding down the alt key and using the right mouse button.
Sometimes the best defense is more offense; use Mordekaiser's abilities to charge up his shield.
Remember that Children of the Grave can be used defensively because of its lifesteal component.
enemytips: Mordekaiser's abilities charge up his shield, making him tougher to kill over time. Try focusing fire on Mordekaiser to burst him down.
Keep your distance and don't stand near creep waves since he'll be aiming Siphon of Destruction at them.
Watch out for the Children of the Grave and Ignite combo. If you're low enough, this will kill you and give his team a powerful ghost.

riot_spell_q.name: Mace of Spades
riot_spell_q.description: Mordekaiser's next three attacks deal escalating bonus damage.
riot_spell_q.tooltip: Mordekaiser's next three hits are empowered. The first two strikes deal {{ e3 }} (+{{ f1 }}) (+{{ f2 }}) bonus magic damage. The final strike deals {{ e9 }} times the bonus damage of the previous strikes, up to {{ f5 }} (+{{ f3 }}) (+{{ f4 }}).

riot_spell_w.name: Harvesters of Sorrow
riot_spell_w.description: Coats an ally in magnetic metal, increasing each unit's movement speed toward one another. While near one another, the metal swirls violently dealing damage per second to enemies.
riot_spell_w.tooltip:
Passive: Mordekaiser gains bonus experience for killing minions near allied champions.

Bonus Experience Earned: {{ f3 }}

Active: Target an ally, linking them to Mordekaiser:
  • Both gain up to {{ e5 }} movement speed toward one another.
  • When they touch, they deal {{ e2 }} (+{{ a1 }}) magic damage over 4 seconds to nearby enemies.
  • Reactivate to both instantly steal {{ e6 }} (+{{ a2 }}) health from nearby enemies ({{ e7 }}% heal on minions, max {{ e8 }} units; deals magic damage).

riot_spell_e.name: Siphon of Destruction
riot_spell_e.description: Mordekaiser deals damage to enemies in a cone in front of him. For each unit hit, Mordekaiser's shield absorbs energy.
riot_spell_e.tooltip:
Mordekaiser deals {{ e3 }} (+{{ a1 }}) (+{{ a1 }}) magic damage in a cone.

For each Champion hit, he gains {{ f1 }}% maximum shield.

riot_spell_r.name: Children of the Grave
riot_spell_r.description: Mordekaiser curses an enemy champion or the Dragon, stealing a percent of their life initially and each second. If the target dies while the spell is active, their soul is enslaved and will follow Mordekaiser as a ghost.
riot_spell_r.tooltip:
Passive - Dragon Force: Damaging the Dragon will Curse it for 10 seconds.

Active: Curse target Champion and steal {{ e1 }}% (+{{ a1 }}%) of their maximum health (25% initially, 75% over 10 seconds; deals magic damage).

Curse Effect: When killed by Mordekaiser's team, the Cursed unit's soul will follow Mordekaiser for {{ e9 }} seconds. Mordekaiser gains {{ e7 }}% of their ability power and {{ e8 }}% of their bonus health. The ghost gains (+{{ f1 }}) attack damage and (+{{ f2 }}) health.

The ghost can be controlled by holding the alt key and using the right mouse button or by reactivating this ability.

riot_spell_i.name: Iron Man
riot_spell_i.description: A percent of the damage dealt from abilities is converted into a temporary shield, absorbing incoming damage.

wikia_skill_i1.name: Darkness Rise
wikia_skill_i1.description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Mordekaiser's''' basic attacks deal {{as|40% AP}} {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage on-hit}}.
wikia_skill_i1.description2: Abilities or basic attacks grant 1 stack per enemy champion or large monster hit. At 3 stacks, '''Mordekaiser''' gains ''Darkness Rise'' for 5 seconds. Further basic attacks and abilities against enemy champions and large monsters refresh the duration.
wikia_skill_i1.description3: {{sbc|Darkness Rise:}} '''Mordekaiser''' deals {{ft|{{pp|10 to 35.5}} {{as|(+ 30% AP)}} {{as|(+ {{pp|key=%|1 to 5}} of target's '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|magic damage}} per second|{{pp|10*0.125 to 35.5*0.125}} {{as|(+ {{ap|30*0.125}}% AP)}} {{as|(+ {{pp|key=%|1*0.125 to 6.1*0.125}} of target's '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|magic damage}} every {{fd|0.125}} seconds}} to all nearby enemies and gains {{as|{{pp|3|key=%|changedisplay=true|3 to 9|1 to 11}} '''bonus''' movement speed}}.
wikia_skill_i1.notes:
* ''Darkness Rise's'' damage doesn't refresh ''Darkness Rise's'' buff.
* {{iis|Dead Man's Plate}} bonus damage gives one bonus stack for ''Darkness Rise'', even at 0 ''Momentum'' stacks.

wikia_skill_q1.name: Obliterate
wikia_skill_q1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Mordekaiser''' smashes the area in the target direction, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all enemies hit, increased if it hits only one enemy.

wikia_skill_w1.name: Indestructible
wikia_skill_w1.description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Mordekaiser''' stores 30% of damage he deals and 15% of damage he takes, reduced by 75% against non-champion sources, as ''Potential Shield'' on his secondary resource bar, up to {{sti|health|{{as|30% of his '''maximum''' health}}}}. The ''Potential Shield'' bar has a minimum of {{as|5% of his '''maximum''' health}}.
wikia_skill_w1.description2: {{sbc|Active - First Cast:}} '''Mordekaiser''' consumes all his current ''Potential Shield'' to {{tip|shield}} himself for 4 seconds for the same amount. At start the shield decays very slowly but exponentially increases near the end. After {{fd|0.25}} seconds he can re-cast the ability.
wikia_skill_w1.description3: {{sbc|Active - Second Cast:}} '''Mordekaiser''' consumes the remaining shield, {{tip|healing}} for a percentage of the amount.

wikia_skill_e1.name: Death's Grasp
wikia_skill_e1.description2: {{sbc|Active:}} After a small delay, '''Mordekaiser''' {{tip|airborne|pulls}} enemies in the targeted area over a fixed distance, dealing {{as|magic damage}}.

wikia_skill_r1.name: Realm of Death
wikia_skill_r1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Mordekaiser''' {{tip|slow|slows}} the targeted enemy champion by 75% for {{ct|cast|{{fd|0.5}}}} seconds. If the target is still in range and targetable by the end of the duration they're banished together with '''Mordekaiser''' to the ''Death Realm'' for 7 seconds, during which they {{tip|suppression|cannot}} leave.
wikia_skill_r1.description2: Units between realms see each other as spirits, considering each other dead and negating any interactions between the two. Only the target and '''Mordekaiser''' will enter the realm, other champions cannot follow them. Everything that occurs inside the ''Death Realm'' is hidden, and all non-champion [[pets]] still inside are destroyed at the end.
wikia_skill_r1.description3: For the same duration '''Mordekaiser''' also reduces the target's '''current''' {{as|attack damage}}, {{as|ability power}}, {{as|'''total''' attack speed}}, {{as|'''maximum''' health}}, {{as|armor}}, {{as|magic resist}}, and size by 10%, in addition to gaining them for himself. If '''Mordekaiser''' kills his target, he consumes their soul, keeping their partial stats until they respawn.
wikia_skill_r1.description4: If one of the two affected champions leave the ''Death Realm'', because of having died or having it dispelled, the other will do so as well, but the stats will remain stolen for the full duration.
wikia_skill_r1.effect_radius: {{tt|1200|The center changes based on Mordekaiser's position from the target}}
wikia_skill_r1.notes:
* The ability will cancel and go on cooldown after the cast time if:
** The target is {{tip|unstoppable}} or {{tip|spell shield|cc-immune}}.
** He targets a [[decoy]] or {{cai|Glory in Death|Sion}}.
* The ability will cancel without going on cooldown if:
** The target is {{tip|untargetable}}.
** He loses sight of his target.
** The target is too far away.
* The boundaries are not considered terrain ({{ai|Unstoppable Onslaught|Sion|exception}}), but enemies that try to move out of the area will be displaced back inside.
** Abilities such as {{ai|Comet of Legend|Aurelion Sol}} and {{ai|Keeper's Verdict|Poppy}} will cap their effect range to the boundary. Targets will stop at the boundary even after it expired.
* Multiple ''Death Realms'' spawned will exist in the same dimension, allowing champions to see and interact with champions bound to other circles. Champions are only affected by their boundaries and are not able to see the others.
** {{cai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} can carry a target outside of their circle, but they will be displaced back inside once {{ai|Regurgitate|Tahm Kench|Regurgitated}}.
** An active {{ai|Assault and Battery|Vi}} on a target outside the perimeter will cause {{ci|Vi}} to continue her charge until her circle ends. She can knockback and damage secondary targets multiple times.
* The transition in and out of the Death Realm doesn't interrupt [[channel]]s and doesn't affect the target's commands. Being in Death Realm can be dispelled if:
** The target uses {{ii|Quicksilver Sash|cc-removals}}.
** '''Mordekaiser''' or the target cast another ''Realm of Death''. The affected champions will remain stuck for the duration of the new circle.
* [[Tether]] effects will break upon entering the dimension, unless it is between the two champions entering the dimension.
* [[Structures]] exist in all realms at the same time, and {{tip|turrets}} will target normally as if all units were in the same realm.
* Effects interactions:
** {{ai|The Hextech Ultimatum|Camille}}, catching a {{ai|Spinning Axe|Draven}}, {{ai|Timewinder|Ekko}}, {{ai|Test of Spirit|Illaoi}}, {{ai|Null Zone|Malzahar}}, {{ai|Twisted Advance|Maokai}}, {{ai|Threaded Volley 2|Taliyah|Worked Grounds}}, {{ai|Gravity Field|Viktor}}, {{ai|Satchel Charge|Ziggs}}, {{ui|Rift Scuttler|Rift Scuttler's}} {{bi|Speed Shrine}} and gaining {{ii|Zeke's Convergence}} [[File:Harbinger of Frost icon.png|20px|border|link=File:Harbinger of Frost icon.png]] '''Harbinger of Frost''' effect are exceptions and may still take effect between dimensions.
** Effects such as {{ai|Requiem|Karthus}}, {{ai|Absolute Zero|Nunu}}, {{ai|Grand Skyfall|Pantheon}} and {{ai|Final Spark|Lux}} will only deal damage to enemies of the dimension they're in at time of cast. Ending the channel or cast time while inside another dimension will not do damage to nearby enemies.
** {{ai|Shuriken Flip|Akali}} may be re-cast inside the ''Death Realm'' even if its target is outside it, but ''Akali'' will stop ''dashing'' upon colliding with the boundary.
** {{ai|Fear Beyond Death 2|Urgot|Fear Beyond Death}} may not be re-cast while his victim is not in the same realm as him, but an already chained foe will still continue to be reeled in and executed. The {{tip|fear}} is cast in the realm Urgot is in.
** {{ai|Void Shift|Malzahar}} dispels from ''Realm of Death's'' slow, making it vulnerable to the ''Death Realm''.
** {{ai|Clockwork Windup|Orianna|Ball}} will instantly return back to her if she's in another dimension.
** Controllable [[pets]] and [[decoys]] are still controllable between realms.
* {{pending for test}}:
** {{ci|Tahm Kench}} {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench|Devours}} the target affected by ''Death Realm'' before it ends.
